result.execSummary:
The defendant Desiree L Bakalar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Desiree L Bakalar was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Desiree L Bakalar is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Desiree L Bakalar was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

supervisions.notes: To pay the costs of the action. Cash bond applied. Defendant has set up a payment plan for $75 monthly. First payment due by 8/15/16.
Huber release and good time granted. Credit for time served. 60 days to report.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Desiree L Bakalar

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for DNA Sample

Defendant Desiree L Bakalar in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Defense gives sentencing argument. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Random listing report, jury seating chart, voir dire list, juror selection and peremptory challenges, juror sign in sheet
forms
Defendant's

Defendant Desiree L Bakalar in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews some preliminary matters with counsel. Court addresses State's motion in limine. Atty Korb makes statement on motion. Atty Nordin gives argument. State responds. Court rules on motion. Defense requests sequestration of witnesses. Court grants motion. Voir dire begins. Oath of Qualification given. Oath of Trial Panel given. State offers Exh. 1 - Stipulated testimony. Received by the court. Recess 10:18 am. Back in session 10:37 am. State/Defense give opening statements. Lee Charles testifies, sworn. Cross. State Exh. 3, 4, 5, 8 offered and received. Redirect, recross. Jury excused for lunch. Court puts sidebar on the record. Court questions counsel on Exh. 1. Corrections made. Recess 11:57 am. Back in session 1:16 pm. Jeremiah Sexton testifies, sworn.  State Exh. 7, 9 & 10 offered and received. Dep. Tom Lemke testifies, sworn. State Exh. 2 & 6 offered and received. Cross, redirect. Officer Neil Dorner testifies, sworn. Cross. Jury excused. Court puts sidebars on the record. Recess 2:30 pm. Back in session 2:44 pm. Officer Brandon Cromwell testifies, sworn. State Exh. 11, offered and received. Officer Chad Mielke testifes, sworn. Cross, redirect. State rests. Jury excused. Atty Nordin indicates defendant will not testify. Court questions defendant, finds defendant is freely, voluntarily & intelligently waiving her right to testify. Defense moves for directive verdict, makes statement. Court denies motion.  Court reviews jury instructions with counsel. Recess 3:51 pm. Back in session 4:08 pm.  Defense rests. Court gives preliminary instructions. State/Defense give closing arguments. State gives rebuttal argument. Court gives final instructions. Oath of Bailiff given. Jury to deliberations 5:15 pm.  Exhibits 2-11 will be sent in to the jury. Recess 5:16 pm. Back on the record 5:58 pm. Jury returns with a verdict. Jury finds defendant not guilty of Ct. 1. Jury finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2. Court finds defendant not guilty of Ct. 3. Jury excused. State requests judgment on verdict re: Ct. 2. Court finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2, dismisses Cts. 1 & 3. Sentencing set for 7/22/16 at 2:45 pm. Bond remains in effect.
State's Motion in Limine #3 - Admissibility of witnesse statements-hearsay exceptions and prior inconsisten statements
Defendant's
Defendant's proposed substantive jury instruction 1766 (obstructing), 1900 (disorderly conduct), 1347 (second degree recklessly endangering safety)
State's
State's Motion in Limine #1, #2

Defendant Desiree L Bakalar in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Court inquires whether defense is objecting to State's motion. Atty Nordin not objecting, makes statement on motion. State responds. State is not objecting to Defendant's motion. Defense responds. Discussion on issues that may come up at trial. Court addresses State's motion in limine. Atty Nordin indicates she will be filing her motion in limine the morning of trial. Court will take both motions up before start of the trial. Bond remains in effect.
Defendant's motion to admit "other acts" evidence of the alleged victim
State's motion regarding OWI/BAC evidence

Defendant Desiree L Bakalar in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, indicates this matter is in the #1 position for trial. Atty Nordin indicates matter is still proceeding to trial, would like another pretrial date to clear up any issues before trial. Court would like any motions, jury instructions and verdict forms by next pretrial date. State indicates they are withdrawing their offer. Bond remains in effect.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
from Atty Nordin requesting pretrial be moved from 6/27/16 to 6/20/16 when she'll be in court on another matter. Court reschedules.
Pre-trial conference on June 20, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Jury trial on July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 27, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Desiree L Bakalar in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Nordin indicates the case is not resolved at this time, asks court to set matter for pretrial and trial. Court will set matter for pretrial and trial. Bond remains in effect.
from Atty Nordin requesting to appear by phone for 3/18/16 hearing. Court reschedules matter.
Status conference on April 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
from ADA Korb objecting to modification of bond.
No contact modfication request. Court will address at 3/18/16 hearing.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Desiree L Bakalar in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 02-10-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Desiree L Bakalar in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Set for prelim.  Bond remains in effect.
Defense Discovery Demand
from Atty Nordin asking to reschedule 12/21/15 IA because of a conflict. Court reschedules.
Initial appearance at 12-28-2015 09:00 am
Defendant was fingerprinted 12/11/15. (fingerprint card destroyed 7/28/16)
Door County Jail
No contact direct or indirect with L.C.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Desiree L Bakalar appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 12-21-15 at 10:00 am.
by Andrea Bakalar
